SEARCH
Package ca.mcgill.splendorserver.controllers

Class GameManager

java.lang.Object
ca.mcgill.splendorserver.controllers.GameManager
@Component public class GameManager extends Object
This is the controller for all game managing functionality. This classed is used to separate the REST endpoints with the different controller functionality.

  • Method Details

    • launchGame

      public static void launchGame(String gameId, SessionData session)
      Provides functionality of launching a game. This function is called by the launchGame endpoint(PUT /api/splendor/{gameId})
      Parameters:
      gameId - the unique id of the game
      session - the data about the session

    • getGame

      public static Game getGame(String gameId)
      Returns the game saved in the active game list.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the id of the game we want to find.
      Returns:
      the game object saved

    • purchaseCard

      public static org.json.simple.JSONObject purchaseCard(Game game, String playerId, int cardId)
      Adds a card to a players inventory. does pay for the card.
      Parameters:
      game - the game where the player and card reside.
      playerId - the player in question.
      cardId - the card the player wishes to acquire.
      Returns:
      the JSONObject response containing the action being done, and choices for user.

    • determineBody

      public static org.json.simple.JSONObject determineBody(Card card, Board board, Inventory inventory)
      Creates the body for http responses.
      Parameters:
      card - that was purchased/acquired.
      board - of the game in question.
      inventory - of the player acquiring the card.
      Returns:
      the JSONObject response containing the action being done, and choices for user.

    • acquireCard

      public static boolean acquireCard(Card card, Board board, Inventory inventory)
      Adds a card to a players inventory. does not pay for the card.
      Parameters:
      card - the card the player wishes to acquire.
      board - the board on which the card resides.
      inventory - the inventory we wish to add the card to.
      Returns:
      whether the acquisition was successful.

    • takeTokens

      public static org.json.simple.JSONObject takeTokens(Game game, String playerId, Token[] tokens)
      Action of taking tokens.
      Parameters:
      game - the game in which the action takes place
      playerId - the player taking the tokens
      tokens - the tokens to take
      Returns:
      a JSONObject of the player's token overflow following taking tokens (max 10)

    • getGameBoard

      public static Optional<Board> getGameBoard(String gameId)
      Gets the game board of the game with the provided ID.
      Parameters:
      gameId - id of game
      Returns:
      Optional is used in this case as we might not have found the game

    • deleteGame

      public static void deleteGame(String gameId)
      Deletes the given game from the registry.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the id of the games

    • reserveCard

      public static boolean reserveCard(Game game, String playerId, String source, int cardId, String deckId)
      Functionality for a player to reserve a card. It makes sure that the player is part of the game they requested from.
      Parameters:
      game - the game that its being played
      playerId - id of the player taking the action
      source - the data receive from the request
      cardId - the card being reserved
      deckId - id of deck the card came from (if any)
      Returns:
      true or false depending if the player can or cannot reserve card

    • getGameRegistry

      public HashMap<String,Game> getGameRegistry()
      Returns the game registry.
      Returns:
      gameRegistry

    • acquireNoble

      public static boolean acquireNoble(Noble noble, Board board, Inventory inventory)
      Adds a card to a players inventory. does not pay for the card.
      Parameters:
      noble - the noble the player wishes to acquire.
      board - the board on which the card resides.
      inventory - the inventory we wish to add the card to.
      Returns:
      whether the acquisition was successful.

    • endTurn

      public static void endTurn(Game game)
      Ends a game turn by updating the current player of a game.
      Parameters:
      game - the game where the turn is ending
